channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘My brother found God in recovery’: How do you save for retirement when ‘God will provide’ is your core value?
item.description: “Are there CFPs who are more aligned with a pragmatic, yet Christian, approach?”

item.title: Customers are rushing to coffee shops like Starbucks, Dunkin’ thanks to the pumpkin-spice latte ‘halo effect’
item.description: Starbucks sees foot traffic spike 24% thanks to PSLs. “It’s great just to get people in the door,” analysts say.

item.title: Consumers turn increasingly pessimistic about U.S. job market
item.description: A key gauge of the outlook on the labor market fell to its lowest reading since February 2021.

item.title: Meta’s ‘gravity-defying’ growth means it’s getting closer to this intriguing milestone
item.description: The company has successfully utilized artificial intelligence to grow its ad business and take share from Google Ads.

item.title: Wall Street is more focused on Nvidia than on threats to Fed independence. That may be a big mistake.
item.description: The question is whether the calm will hold.

item.title: UL Solutions opens 1st service robot testing lab
item.description: The laboratory, located in South Korea, will test robots for use in homes, retail shops, restaurants, schools and public spaces. The post UL Solutions...

item.title: This website lets you blind-test GPT-5 vs. GPT-4o—and the results may surprise you
item.description: Take this blind test to discover whether you truly prefer OpenAI's GPT-5 or the older GPT-4o—without knowing which model you're using.

item.title: Developers lose focus 1,200 times a day — how MCP could change that
item.description: One of the most impactful applications of MCP is its ability to connect AI coding assistants directly to developer tools.

item.title: Busted by the em dash — AI’s favorite punctuation mark, and how it’s blowing your cover
item.description: AI is brilliant at polishing and rephrasing. But like a child with glitter glue, you still need to supervise it.

item.title: OpenCUA’s open source computer-use agents rival proprietary models from OpenAI and Anthropic
item.description: The open source framework provides the data and training recipe for building powerful computer-use agents that challenge proprietary systems.

item.title: Meta is partnering with Midjourney and will license its technology for ‘future models and products’
item.description: Details are scarce on how much if any money is involved. And what does it mean for Midjourney's previously announced plans for an enterprise API?
